list_ex_of_english: A mahogany and horsehair settee is against the wall.
They offered sofas, chairs, tables, bedsteads and stands, settees, cradles, rocking chairs and all other articles in the furniture line.
Then there was the £40 bed settee which crumpled and became unusable in a week.
In the living room there was a bit of linoleum, one seat and a broken settee.
Residents sat in the lounges or sat on settees in the lobby area by the lifts.
Yet not everybody requires a settee and two chairs, nor a wardrobe, dressing-table and chest, nor a sideboard, table and four chairs.
The rooms are furnished like a parlor which is cluttered with all sorts of easy chairs, sofas, chaise longues and settees, each covered with a white spread.
When we look at the price of one settee at about £1,000 for that type of accommodation, we can see that those furnishings are not cheap.
